column3:
I was a bit foggy last night when writing the description after going in circles with SDKs and toolchains all day, so I'll try to provide a better breakdown here.

#### XCode

When building in the normal OSX ecosystem (download a monolithic Xcode release and use it without asking questions), the compiler, linker, build tools, and SDKs all come together. However, they retain a relatively high a

While I was looking at the clang-3.4 problem yesterday, robbak on IRC happened to be wrestling with the same problem on FreeBSD. I tested a vanilla osx build from llvm.org natively on osx, and it had the same problem. \n\nI've managed to track down the problem, and have a confirmed fix. This https://github.com/llvm-mirror/clang/commit/c174fe5f125f749eaf5ea7cc41f3cbf049bc5ada needs to be backported
Nice. Tested. This fixes the Qt issue of building on 10.9 with the 10.10 SDK.\n
Thanks for figuring this all out @theuni!\nIs this intended for 0.10rc2 or just master?\n
@laanwj master only. I don't foresee any problems, but it'd be far too risky for 0.10 at the last minute.\n
First commit dropped, and rebased on top of #5586\n
